div.p: Well-educated, pious and wise, especially gracious, dear sir, my willing service and all good things are prepared for you in advance. Since I have understood that this year, by the grace of God, a lot of wine has grown with you, I have not wanted to withhold from you some growth from the vineyard in Rol, which I hereby send you a small barrel. From this, have the barrel, which I sent you last year, filled. To my other gracious, dear sirs, such as Mr. Rudolf Gwalther, Ludwig Lavater, and also Mr. Wolfgang Haller, distribute equally with a request, that they may accept it as a small gift for a good, prosperous year (which I hereby wish you all from the heart) well rewarded. I hereby offer to render you all possible services. We have no news here at the moment, other than what you are undoubtedly well informed about by the mayor of Cham; whom we want to greet very friendly. I hereby commend you to the protection of God Almighty.
From Bern, December 14, 1566. Your always willing servant, Johann Steiger wrote.
To the highly learned, pious, honorable and wise Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, leader of the divine word of the church in Zurich, my gracious lord and good friend.
